node.title: Social distancing, PPE not used until first case emerged during Australia's deadliest aged care COVID-19 outbreak
node.alt: A sign for the St Basil's Greek Orthodox aged care home in Fawkner attached to a wire fence.
node.description: A coronial inquest into the outbreak at St Basil's in Melbourne's north that led to the deaths of 50 people has heard a staff member who spread COVID to the facility was permitted to come to work after reporting flu-like symptoms.
node.content:
["Nursing home workers at the centre of Australia's deadliest coronavirus outbreak have told an inquest they did not use personal protective equipment (PPE) or socially distance until the first positive case was detected.", "Staff at St Basil's Homes for the Aged, where 50 people died during Victoria's\u00a0second wave,\u00a0were also allowed to go to work if they were asymptomatic under workplace policies in place at the time.", "The\u00a0testimony has been aired before Victorian Coroner, John Cain, who is investigating the deaths in July and August last year.", "The inquest today heard from registered nurse Jagmeet Nagra, who was contacted by a staff member who became the first person at St Basil's to become infected.", "The staff member, who cannot be named, is being represented by lawyer Sam Norton, who put to Ms Nagra that she ultimately gave permission for them to attend work.", "The staff member had called Ms Nagra to tell her their spouse and another family member had been experiencing flu-like symptoms.", "\"To be absolutely clear, you were saying to her, on the basis of the information you've given me, you are okay to go to work, you agree with that?\" Mr Norton said.", "\"I agree because [they] were asymptomatic,\" Ms Nagra said.", "\"And that's consistent with the policy \u2026 if you are asymptomatic you are okay to come to work?\" Mr Norton said.", "\"That's right,\" she said.", "The coroner heard that when the woman went to work, she was informed that a family member had tested positive.", "
No social distancing or PPE before first positive\u00a0case
", "Ms Nagra\u00a0told the inquest that it was only after the staff member tested positive that PPE started being used at the facility.", "\"Do you recall whether it was immediate?\" Naomi Hodgson, a lawyer assisting the coroner, said.", "\"I can't recall exactly the time and the date but next day I can recall \u2026 they came and they give the PPE training,\" Ms Nagra said.", "Ms Nagra told the inquest that staff members started practising social distancing after the positive case.", "\"Is that prior to the outbreak, so prior to that first staff member becoming positive?\"\u00a0Ms Hodgson asked.", "\"Prior to that we wasn't doing social distancing,\" Ms Nagra said.", "\"But you had a lot of training in infection prevention control \u2026 and was social distancing not part of that?\" Ms Hodgson said.", "\"We was trying to make, like telling staff members during the handover, like you know please don't be on top of each other, but not 1.5 [metres] like how we do now,\" Ms Nagra said.", "", "
A nurse at St Basil's says hospital staff became \"annoyed\" with her for sending residents to hospital.(AAP: Daniel Pockett)
", "The coroner was told that once the nursing home's residents began getting infected, Ms Nagra was directed by her boss to send them to the hospital but faced pushback because the hospital was \"annoyed\".", "She told the coroner that she successfully managed to send four patients to hospital before staff there became \"angry\" with her.", "She said no ambulances arrived for up to three patients.", "\"No one came to pick them up,\" Ms Nagra told the coroner.", "\"They're refusing to take the residents.\"", "Ms Nagra said at that point, her boss intervened.", "The inquest continues."]
